activities.name: Cherry Blossoms at EUR Lake
activities.description: Visit the Japanese-style gardens around EUR Lake when the cherry trees burst into bloom, creating a stunning pink canopy.
activities.seasonal_notes: The cherry blossoms typically peak in late March to early April, creating a magical atmosphere reminiscent of Japan.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for the best light for photography and fewer crowds.

activities.name: Rome's Rose Garden (Roseto Comunale)
activities.description: Explore this beautiful garden on the Aventine Hill, home to over 1,100 varieties of roses in bloom during spring.
activities.seasonal_notes: Only open during spring (typically May-June) when the roses are in bloom, offering stunning views of the Circus Maximus.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; combine with a visit to the nearby Orange Garden for panoramic views.

activities.name: Holy Week and Easter Celebrations
activities.description: Experience the profound religious ceremonies of Holy Week in Rome, culminating with Easter Mass in St. Peter's Square.
activities.seasonal_notes: One of the most significant religious events in Rome, with the Pope leading many ceremonies. Easter Sunday features a massive gathering at the Vatican.
activities.booking_tips: For Easter Mass, free tickets are required and must be reserved months in advance through the Prefecture of the Papal Household.

activities.name: Rome Marathon
activities.description: Watch or participate in the annual Rome Marathon, which takes runners past the city's most iconic monuments.
activities.seasonal_notes: Usually held in early spring, the marathon offers a unique way to experience Rome's historic center when streets are closed to traffic.
activities.booking_tips: Register well in advance if participating; spectators can watch for free along the route.

activities.name: Artichoke Season in the Jewish Ghetto
activities.description: Sample Carciofi alla Giudia (Jewish-style artichokes) in Rome's historic Jewish Quarter when these vegetables are at their peak.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is artichoke season in Rome, with March and April offering the most tender and flavorful specimens.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables at popular restaurants like Nonna Betta or Ba'Ghetto in advance, especially for weekend meals.

activities.name: Explore the Villa Borghese Gardens
activities.description: Wander through Rome's most elegant park, with its manicured gardens, lake, and multiple museums, all vibrant with spring blooms.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings lush greenery and flowers to the park, perfect for picnics and leisurely strolls.
activities.booking_tips: While the park is free, attractions like the Borghese Gallery require advance booking, especially in spring.

activities.name: Rome's Birthday Celebrations (Natale di Roma)
activities.description: Join the celebrations for Rome's birthday (April 21st), featuring historical reenactments and parades by groups dressed as ancient Romans.
activities.seasonal_notes: This unique spring festival commemorates the legendary founding of Rome in 753 BCE, with activities centered around the Roman Forum and Circus Maximus.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; check the official program for specific event times and locations.

activities.name: Lungo il Tevere
activities.description: Experience the early days of this summer-long festival along the Tiber River, with food stalls, craft markets, and live performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: Late spring sees the beginning of this popular event, which continues through summer with a more pleasant climate than the summer heat.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; stroll along the riverbanks between Ponte Sublicio and Ponte Sisto.

activities.name: Visit the Vatican Museums
activities.description: Explore one of the world's greatest art collections, including the Sistine Chapel, during spring when crowds are manageable.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers a balance of decent weather and fewer crowds compared to the summer peak season.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online well in advance and choose early morning entry times to avoid the longest lines.

activities.name: Opera at the Baths of Caracalla
activities.description: Experience world-class opera and ballet performances in the magnificent ruins of the ancient Roman baths.
activities.seasonal_notes: The summer opera season typically runs from June to August, offering magical performances under the stars.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance as performances often sell out, especially for popular operas.

activities.name: Aperitivo on a Rooftop Bar
activities.description: Enjoy the Italian tradition of pre-dinner drinks and snacks while taking in panoramic views from one of Rome's many rooftop bars.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for rooftop dining, offering both relief from the heat and spectacular sunset views.
activities.booking_tips: Make reservations for popular spots like Hotel Raphael, Aroma at Palazzo Manfredi, or La Terrazza del Cesari.

activities.name: Lungo il Tevere Summer Festival
activities.description: Explore this vibrant summer-long festival along the Tiber River, featuring open-air bars, restaurants, artisan markets, and performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: The festival runs through summer (June-September), transforming the riverbanks into a lively social hub perfect for warm evenings.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; the festival gets busier after 9PM, especially on weekends.

activities.name: Night Visit to the Colosseum
activities.description: Experience the ancient Colosseum in a different light with special evening openings during summer months.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer nights offer a mystical atmosphere and cooler temperatures to explore this iconic monument.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online well in advance as space is limited for night tours.

activities.name: Gay Village
activities.description: Visit Rome's popular LGBTQ+ summer festival featuring concerts, dance parties, film screenings, and cultural events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Running from June to September, this festival creates a vibrant summer nightlife venue with changing themes and events.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official website for specific events; some special nights may require advance tickets.

activities.name: Day Trip to Ostia Antica
activities.description: Explore the remarkably preserved ancient Roman port city, a less crowded alternative to Pompeii and just 30 minutes from Rome.
activities.seasonal_notes: Visit in the early morning during summer to avoid the midday heat while exploring these extensive ruins.
activities.booking_tips: No advance booking needed; take the Roma-Lido train from Porta San Paolo station near Piramide metro.

activities.name: Roman Beach Day at Santa Marinella
activities.description: Escape the city heat with a day trip to this charming beach town, easily accessible by train from Rome.
activities.seasonal_notes: The perfect summer respite from Rome's heat, with both free public beaches and rental beach clubs (stabilimenti).
activities.booking_tips: Trains run regularly from Roma Termini or Roma San Pietro; for beach clubs, arrive early or book sun beds in advance on summer weekends.

activities.name: Estate Romana Events
activities.description: Participate in Rome's summer cultural program featuring outdoor concerts, cinema, dance performances, and art exhibits throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: This summer-long cultural initiative transforms various Roman venues into open-air entertainment spaces.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official Estate Romana website for the schedule; popular events may require advance booking.

activities.name: Swim at Hydromania Water Park
activities.description: Cool off at Rome's largest water park, featuring slides, pools, and entertainment for all ages.
activities.seasonal_notes: A refreshing escape during Rome's hottest summer days, particularly popular with families.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid entrance lines; arrive early for the best spot to set up for the day.

activities.name: Harvest Season in Roman Castles
activities.description: Take a day trip to the Castelli Romani area for wine harvesting celebrations and seasonal food festivals.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is grape and olive harvest season in the hills surrounding Rome, with many towns hosting sagre (food festivals).
activities.booking_tips: Check local events calendars; trains run regularly to Frascati and other towns from Termini Station.

activities.name: Rome Film Festival
activities.description: Experience international cinema at the prestigious Rome Film Festival, featuring premieres, retrospectives, and celebrity appearances.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held annually in October, this major cultural event attracts film enthusiasts from around the world.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets for screenings online as soon as they're released, especially for high-profile premieres.

activities.name: Visit the Vatican Museums
activities.description: Explore the extensive Vatican collections, including the Sistine Chapel, during the less crowded autumn season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers smaller crowds than summer while still providing comfortable weather for Vatican City exploration.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance; consider a Friday night visit when occasionally available for a unique experience.

activities.name: Explore the Protestant Cemetery
activities.description: Visit the final resting place of poets Keats and Shelley among other notable figures in this serene and historic cemetery.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's golden light and falling leaves create a particularly atmospheric setting for visiting this peaceful spot.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; donations are appreciated for the maintenance of this historic site.

activities.name: Autumn Day Trip to Villa d'Este
activities.description: Visit the magnificent Renaissance gardens and fountains at Tivoli, even more charming as the leaves begin to change color.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings comfortable temperatures and fewer tourists to this UNESCO World Heritage site.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online; combine with nearby Hadrian's Villa for a full day excursion.

activities.name: Museum Marathon
activities.description: Take advantage of the comfortable autumn weather to explore Rome's countless museums and galleries.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is ideal for indoor cultural activities, with new exhibitions often opening for the season.
activities.booking_tips: Consider the Roma Pass for multiple museum entries; book major sites like Galleria Borghese well in advance.

activities.name: All Saints' Day at Campo Verano
activities.description: Experience the atmospheric tradition of visiting Rome's monumental cemetery on November 1st when Italians honor their deceased.
activities.seasonal_notes: This important cultural tradition offers a glimpse into Italian customs surrounding death and remembrance.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; take tram 3 or 19 to reach this massive cemetery complex.

activities.name: Truffle and Mushroom Season
activities.description: Sample autumn's prized delicacies at Rome's restaurants, which feature special seasonal menus highlighting truffles and wild mushrooms.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings these coveted ingredients to Roman tables, with many restaurants offering special truffle menus.
activities.booking_tips: Make reservations at restaurants known for seasonal cuisine like Armando al Pantheon or Roscioli.

activities.name: Soccer Match at Stadio Olimpico
activities.description: Experience the passion of Italian football by attending an AS Roma or SS Lazio match at the Olympic Stadium.
activities.seasonal_notes: The football season is in full swing during autumn, with comfortable temperatures for outdoor matches.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets through official team websites; bring ID as it's required to match the name on your ticket.

activities.name: Christmas Market in Piazza Navona
activities.description: Experience Rome's most famous Christmas market, with stalls selling gifts, decorations, and seasonal treats in a baroque setting.
activities.seasonal_notes: Running from early December to Epiphany (January 6), the market is especially magical when illuminated at night.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; visit on weekday evenings for fewer crowds.

activities.name: Midnight Mass at the Vatican
activities.description: Attend the Pope's Christmas Eve Mass at St. Peter's Basilica, one of the most significant religious ceremonies in Rome.
activities.seasonal_notes: This incredibly popular event draws visitors from around the world to experience Christmas in the heart of Catholicism.
activities.booking_tips: Free tickets are required and must be requested from the Prefecture of the Papal Household months in advance.

activities.name: 100 Presepi Exhibition
activities.description: View this annual exhibition showcasing hundreds of nativity scenes from around Italy and the world in various styles.
activities.seasonal_notes: Usually held from late November to early January, this exhibition highlights the Italian tradition of elaborate nativity scenes.
activities.booking_tips: No advance booking needed; location may change yearly so check current venue.

activities.name: New Year's Eve at Piazza del Popolo
activities.description: Join Rome's biggest New Year's celebration with live music, performances, and midnight fireworks in this historic square.
activities.seasonal_notes: The official city celebration attracts both locals and tourists for a festive atmosphere and impressive fireworks display.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; arrive early to secure a good spot and use public transportation as parking is extremely limited.

activities.name: Winter Sales Shopping
activities.description: Take advantage of Italy's regulated winter sales season, with significant discounts at shops throughout Rome.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter sales typically begin in early January and last about six weeks, offering substantial discounts on Italian fashion.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; shop early in the sale period for the best selection.

activities.name: Befana Market at Piazza Navona
activities.description: Experience the conclusion of the Italian holiday season on January 6th (Epiphany) when the gift-bringing witch Befana is celebrated.
activities.seasonal_notes: This uniquely Italian tradition features special events and markets where you can buy Befana dolls and candies.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; the celebration is particularly child-friendly.

activities.name: Ara Pacis Museum Visit
activities.description: Explore this modern museum housing Augustus' ancient Altar of Peace, an ideal indoor activity during winter weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: This climate-controlled museum offers a comfortable winter activity with fewer tourists than in peak season.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online or on-site; consider the Roma Pass if visiting multiple museums.

activities.name: Opera at Teatro dell'Opera di Roma
activities.description: Attend a world-class opera performance during the winter season at Rome's elegant opera house.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings the main opera season with premier productions and internationally renowned performers.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online well in advance, especially for popular performances; dress code is generally elegant.

activities.name: Epiphany at the Vatican
activities.description: Attend the special Papal Mass celebrating Epiphany on January 6th at St. Peter's Basilica.
activities.seasonal_notes: This important date in the Catholic calendar marks the end of the Christmas season with a special celebration.
activities.booking_tips: Free tickets must be requested in advance from the Prefecture of the Papal Household.
